website_summaries.verdict: Long battery life and stylish design combined with improving app software make the Alta HR the best all-around fitness tracker for most people.
pros: The Alta HR has a slim and stylish design with 7-day battery life, and all-day fitness and heart rate tracking
cons: It isn't water-resistant, and notifications can be difficult to read
Automatic exercise tracking and no buttons means no on-band controls

customer_reviews.title: I love my Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fitbit! I think you can get the best usage out of it by also using the phone app. It not only tracks steps, but also heart rate, sleep patterns, food intake, water intake, and exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: WARNING - Has Charging Problems with this Model. Be ready to send it  back under warranty.
customer_reviews.text: WARNING - This is a really great product however it can have a very serious charging problem. If you do not believe me search the internet for Fitbit Alta HR Charging problem and you will see plenty of proof. I have one now and I have an open ticket with them. Yes they have support but they will march you through endless steps to get it working. I am not sure if they will fix mine yet, but wanted to warn people that you need to expect to say goodbye to the unit while they fix it, IF they fix it.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Nunya

customer_reviews.title: Worthless for exercise
customer_reviews.text: Tracks heartbeat all day but becomes useless when you start exercising. No amount of adjusting the position or tightness gives consistent pickup. Half the time or more you just get "---". Also no way to start and leave exercise mode, so you can't keep track of time spent. Very frustrating im going to half to buy a Polar to supplement this if I want exercise tracked reliably. Touchscreen responsiveness is also inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Device not responsive after several hours of charging and troubleshooting per Fitbit support instructions on Fitbit forums (ensure charger connected correctly, try multiple times to restart/reset, try to sync with a PC...) Still nothing on the screen or any indication of power. While I like the Fitbit architecture, this is a lot of trouble for a fairly expensive device. I decided to return for a refund rather than bother trying to exchange.
customer_reviews.author: lk1387

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It lets you customize almost everything and is easy to use. You can sync from your computer and then to your phone, then to the device. You don't need the dongle although sometimes it might be useful for some. The charger cord is a bit short too but it's not the end of the world. Depending on where you charge this, you can get a USB extension if necessary. It will charge faster from a wall outlet than a USB connection. Over all, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: KathyDTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: Quick death
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Alta HR when I first got it. Worked great, for 4 months. Now it is losing more and more steps. A mile in March-August was about 22,000 steps. Then it started dropping - 2000, 1900, on til now it registers less than 1500 steps a mile. I tried to work with Customer Service twice. The reps couldn't seem to understand the device was degrading over time under exactly the same circumstance. They kept explaining it must be things I haven't changed at all, like the band, where I wear it, etc. I suppose that's because it's just device failure and they do nothing about that.
customer_reviews.author: L. Scholten

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing Product
customer_reviews.text: I used mine for 14 months (replaced the original band twice). Then it stopped working entirely. Called the product support and their best offer is discount on other products! If these products are only good for such a short period, then either manufacturers should give the buyers heads up and other options before consumers buy, or offer it at lower cost so it's a replaceable. This was my second fitbit with similar results. This is the end of my line with fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: AG Silver

customer_reviews.title: I like the concept of how this product tracts sleep
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of how this product tracts sleep. The fitbit Alta HR does not work properly for me. I place it on the recommended spot 2 inches below wrist and it does not record heart rate consistently. I go through gaps during the day where it does not record. Many times I think it makes up heart rate. I was taking a cycle class and we were at a climatic intense part in class and the fitbit said my hr was at 88 bpm. That is not likely. The device does not record hr consistently when I excercise. That's basically the whole point on why I bought it. Many times it doesn't record hr at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sleek look and great battery life
customer_reviews.text: Really like the Alta over my previous Charge! The look is sleeker, the battery lasts a really long time and they continue to upgrade the app to provide some great feedback on sleep and heart rate.
customer_reviews.author: AJTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Battery defective
customer_reviews.text: The battery started draining after a few hours about a month after I bought this thing. It went from holding its charge for a week to less than half a day. This is the second fitbit I've owned. The band on the first one kept falling apart so I had to throw that one away. I'm done with fitbit. This was the 2nd defective productive of theirs I have bought so I guess the shame is on me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra $50
customer_reviews.text: Started with the Fitbit Alta and bought this for my sister. She gave it back to me because it was not her thing. I want to tell everyone that the extra $50 for the HR is worth paying because you get more detailed sleep reports and heart rate monitoring that helps with exercising. I was happy with my Alta, but now with the HR I'm even more motivated while exercising (which incidentally, I hate doing). Sleep is so important and the detailed reports also motivate me to get more quality sleep because although you may THINK you're getting 8 hours, you probably are not.
customer_reviews.author: Kalina T.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this Fitbit Alta HR for one week and the HR monitor has stopped working and the pink band has black wear showing on it. Extremely disappointed and returning. I owned the Fitbit Alta previous to this and never had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The tracker and the app do not sync together. Fitbit has told me they have been working on this for about 3 - 4 months. After numerous updates still does not sync. If you pay $149.00 for a product that says it has access to an app that will help you will motivate and help you with your workout, healthy eating and sleep and does none of these things. Total waste of money, would not recommend anyone purchase any model because from reading reviews all have problems. Fitbit should be ashamed of themselves.
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product and poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. The bands are cheap and start falling apart almost immediately. (Quick Google search will confirm this is common. Wish I had seen this prior to purchase.) Mine started tearing away within a month of purchase. Fitbit customer support will make you feel criminal when you contact them about it. And if you purchase anything other than the basic model, be prepared to shell out more money to replace their defective item. Fitbit has shameful business practices.
customer_reviews.author: Myka

customer_reviews.title: Alta doesn't do much
customer_reviews.text: This version of the Fitbit is very attractive, but other than that, does not do much compared to the Fitbit Charge 2 that I had purchased twice but needed to return due to a design flaw where the flat screen buckled down the middle. Some internet research showed that this was a common problem so I opted for the Alta. It is very pretty, but compared to the Charge 2, does not do much. Additionally, due to it's smaller size, cannot show as much information on the screen. I just looked at the Fitbit website and saw that there is now a Fitbit Charge 3. I may check that one out to see if I like it better.
customer_reviews.author: MsWano

customer_reviews.title: Falls off wrist
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this FitBit and one of the sides of the wristband kept falling off. Amazon replaced it and after several months it started happening again. I bought third party wristbands thinking the problem was a defective wristband but I had trouble with the new wristbands. I finally realized that the post on one of the sides of the FitBit itself was crooked. The wristbands will never work and now I am stuck with a defective piece of equipment. Even more disappointing is the fact that the first FitBit I had must have had the same defect. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Read the product warning about sun sensitivity
customer_reviews.text: In 2800+ reviews, I think it's all been said, except maybe this: I bought this as a gift for my wife, after reading the fine print in the manual she gave it to my daughter and I've ordered an Alta without the heatbeat monitor for my wife. Basically, it warns not to use if you are photosensitive or have one of several other ailments. Unfortunately, my wife is on a medication that makes her sensitive to the sun so she decided to heed the warning. My daughter, on the other hand, loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Al BeBack

customer_reviews.title: Battery tanks after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: This would be a 5-star review if the device hadn't gone from having the charge lasting a week to roughly a day after ~9 months of daily use. It's been a great insight to see my sleep patterns and resting heart rate and see how different factors change my resting heart rate and sleep from day to day. It's a great device, I've tried many other smart devices that were substandard to this one, but the battery issue here is a major concern.
customer_reviews.author: Mike937

customer_reviews.title: Fits very tiny wrist, mine is just under 5.5 inches!
customer_reviews.text: I have very small wrists measuring barely 5.5 inches. This fits my wrist great! I had an old fitbit charge small and it was bulky and big and left pretty wide gaps around the sides of my wrist. There's no gaps with this one and it feels so light when I'm wearing it. It's also much slimmer which I think looks much better on a small wrist like mine. I've been looking around for a fitbit or other fitness tracker that would fit me properly and not look big and bulky and out of place. If you have tiny wrists like me this will fit you great! I have mine set on the second to last notch and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: turgball

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money for what it does and it stops doing it after a while anyway
customer_reviews.text: 3 months after buying it, it stopped synching with my phone and whenever I'm exercising and my wrists get sweaty, it stops detecting my pulse. Not only that but I eventually realized that it doesn't actially count your steps but your arm movements. Try it for yourself. Sit down and start waving the arm you put your fitbit on for a while. After a minute check your steps. It's ridiculous. Basically it's just a useless watch now. If I wanted a watch I'd rather buy one for $10 from Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Joana Stanoeva

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing! Worked for two days now won't sync ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing!Worked for two days now won't sync. I've tried everything!
customer_reviews.author: CAROL PERRY

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product. I had it less than 2 weeks and it wasn't working correctly. I talked with the Fitbit folks and we trouble shooter the device. I got a return code for the product and now since it is still not working, they say I need to deal with AMAZON but that is a nightmare because they just point you back to the manufacturer. This is $150 and not worth the endless syncing issues and non recording of data.
customer_reviews.author: WPS Publishing

customer_reviews.title: I wish they stood behind their products better
customer_reviews.text: My Fitbit continuously falls open where the device meets the band. It's fallen off during hikes, lifting things, during runs. Fortunately I've been able to find it every time but it's incredibly frustrating and it bothers me that I am unable to get a new band because it falls outside of the return window. A company should stand behind their product, especially when it is faulty and I shouldn't have to spend more money to fix their mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Because of such great reviews, exchanged it & got a 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: I just must be really unlucky. Received my 1st Alta HR, worked w/ tech support but the read out was faulty~like it had a short in it. Wld only display anything abt 20% of the time. Because of such great reviews, exchanged it & got a 2nd one. Works better but you practically have to beat the darn thing up to get a read out. SUPER disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: quicksilver

customer_reviews.title: Walk firmly
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable band, but I prefer my fancy options....tbuthis fitbit doesn't pick up casual walking while shopping. Note: walk firmly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I decided to give Fitbit another try after I had to have my Charge HR 2 replaced 3 times in a year. But I was seduced by the design and the pink color of this model. Not even 2 months after I received it, the plastic parts of the wristband that hold the tracker in place started to break off. So, the tracker started popping off and became unwearable. For the nearly $200 that I paid (the pink was more expensive), this is unacceptable. That plastic should be much sturdier. But again, my experience with fitbit is that their products don't last and are not worth the price paid. I'm going to try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Completely inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this monitor for a few weeks, and it just isn't accurate. I fence, the kind with the swords, and it consistently shows my heart rate at around 110 bpm. I can walk up a flight of stairs and achieve that same heart rate. I'll do burpees for a minute and feel like I am going to keep over from the exertion (I never claimed to be in the best shape) and the Fitbit thinks I'm going for a brisk walk (90 bpm). I would not recommend this Fitbit to anybody who would like the ability to distinguish the difference between walking to the john and running from a hyena.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Brownfield

customer_reviews.title: battery not staying charged
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in August and for over a week now every morning it says 0 battery so I plug it in and I know its plugged in correctly the battery comes up as charging and then shows it is full until the next morning battery is empty again totally frustrated !! I also cant find an email address to talk to someone about it
customer_reviews.author: kim justice

customer_reviews.title: Must be worn 24/7 to work properly!
customer_reviews.text: I really believe that if you don't wear this a majority of the day, it won't function correctly. I really wanted it to help with my workouts, but it either doesn't read my heart rate at all or the number is suspiciously high or low. And it couldn't even track my walk correctly saying it was up to 2 miles longer than it was depending on the day. I know technology can be frustrating, but I have a lot of devices that work way better than this! What a waste of time, energy and MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: K Lyn

customer_reviews.title: I bought this product mid-June 2017. It died mid-Sept ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product mid-June 2017. It died mid-Sept. This is the last time I will buy a Fitbit product. This is the third time I've had one of their products fail within a year.
customer_reviews.author: C. Courtney

customer_reviews.title: "mysteriously" stops working right after warranty expires
customer_reviews.text: Buy an extended warranty on any FITBIT all there products "mysteriously" stop working about a year or so after purchase. Customer service is a joke they'll tell you it's your Fitbit after fake troubleshooting and upsale you. Check the Fitbit community you'll see plenty of evidence of products all going dead around the same time for multiple people. Scam. Several BBB COMPLAINTS filed as well.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Overrated and awful. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to finally get a tracker, but this one is extremely disappointing. I ride my bike quite a lot and it is my favorite exercise, but this tracker does not register my bike rides. In addition, it does not even have the option to do it - it can only track walks, runs, and hikes. Piece of junk considering the price. Also, it is not waterproof (even those 15 dollar trackers are waterproof, but this one can't even do that) so taking it of and putting it on before and after every contact with water is a hassle. Again, NOT recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pavic

customer_reviews.title: Tracker works fine - band is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I usually assume the best of people and companies, but there is no way that Fitbit made the wrist band on this thing so terrible and didn't do it on purpose to sell their additional wristband accessories. After just a couple of months, the part that connects the wrist band to the tracker is already worn out and disconnects all the time no matter what you're doing with it. It's ridiculous. As to the tracker itself, probably worse than normal from Fitbit. It definitely counts pretty much every movement of my wrist, whereas past trackers didn't really count normal wrist movements, just walking. I'd grab the Flex or other model if I were to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam G. Alberti

customer_reviews.title: Today unboxed it and totally in love. My wrist circumference is 16cm and was in ...
customer_reviews.text: Salut everybody. Got my S size Fitbit. This my 1st fitness tracker. Today unboxed it and totally in love. My wrist circumference is 16cm and was in doubt between S or L but decided to take the S one and am happy to order exactly this size. It looks awesome with my pandora bracelet(size 17). When I unboxed it was discharged and charging process took 2hrs l; paired with my iPhone 7 easily. I even trained in it today. Sometimes the display is not responsive maybe i have to get used to it. Let’s see. my assessment for day one is 10 out of 10. Hope it will remain like this :)
customer_reviews.author: natishka

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the Alta hr for close to 3 months now after having the charge hr for two years. Let’s just say I really miss my old watch. The Alta hr is supposed to automatically track workouts, but it more often then not looses the heartbeat and doesn’t even recognize the active minutes much less the actual workout. If you’re looking for a thin digital watch that you can change the band out on, go for it. Don’t expect much else from it though.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: It died right after after the warranty died!
customer_reviews.text: My review was 5 stars until this week when it up and died! No trauma, nothing unusual happened to it. It just stopped. Consumer help had me try all sorts of things, but nothing worked. Then they said too bad but the warranty is only good for one year. I had it for 13 1/2 months. The discount they offered brought the cost down to what it is on Amazon anyway, once you factor in shipping and the $20 more expensive protection plan. Which you obviously need! I trust Amazon, but not Fitbit. They do not re expect their product to last more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: susan shirland

customer_reviews.title: Steps tracking is a hoax/joke
customer_reviews.text: I've had this device for just about 1 week and my initial impressions are that it does a pretty good job of detecting your heart rate as well as your sleep. However, tracking your daily steps and distance is ridiculous. I walk and hike quite a bit and wear the fitbit in conjunction with an Omron Tri-axis pedometer which works quite well. The fitbit is WAY OFF in it's counting compared to my Omron. Probably because the fitbit is secured to your wrist there is no way that it can accurately record your steps properly. I'll update this review when I have it a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: K9Cousin

customer_reviews.title: Stylish fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I really like this fitbit, it's stylish and comfortable, not too bulky. I'm not too sure about the heart rate tracker, it seems to run high. Also, the sleep tracker seems off, it will say I had only a few hours sleep when I know I had more. It seems to only count deep sleep time. The step counter seems to be accurate and it recharges quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tina H.

customer_reviews.title: It was great, but will not sync
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I tried to sync the Fitbit to my Phone and Computer, but it would only sync to my phone. After working well for nine months, it suddenly stopped synching to ANYTHING. I've been through all of the Fitbit trouble shooting pages, and tried them all. It still works, and I can see on the Fitbit all of the usual information, but I can no longer keep track of this information, nor can I share it with my motivational friends. I'm very disappointed. I thought this product was simple enough that with basic care, it would work for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Great at the beginning but not for the long haul
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas 2018 Christmas gift for my wife. She was pleasantly surprised when she opened it but had been hinting for some time about getting one. Helped her set it up and worked great for a few weeks and then the bluetooth function seemed to quit as we could no longer sync to her phone. Have tried various other phones to see where the issue lies and it turned out that the FitBit bluetooth has failed after just a few weeks. So this is now several months later, well past the return date for exchange but wanted to let others know that there could be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: MikeS

customer_reviews.title: What a waste...
customer_reviews.text: As of April 15, 2019, Fitbit stopped supporting my LG Stylo 4, with Android 8.1. As a result, my existing Alta HR (purchased 2/18) and newly ordered Inspire HR aren't compatible (and won't sync) with my smart water bottle and all other fitness apps and devices, which for me, deems the watch useless! Who gives a crap about watch features if the watch doesn't sync!! I loved my Alta HR, but after reaching out to Fitbit customer service, in South America (because they don't "employ agents in the US"), I will never buy or support another Fitbit product - EVER!
customer_reviews.author: A. Van Gogh

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra $$ over the silver version
customer_reviews.text: More subtle than the regular, silver version, so it can be worn on your other wrist if you want to wear a regular watch otherwise. For me, the subtleness of a continuous black band is worth the extra $$. It works great for auto-detecting exercises. But I DO wish it would allow starting/stopping of exercises like the Charge 2. It's basically a passive tracker, checking your HR, tracking your activity, counting your steps, and tracking your sleep. But it's not a full-featured fitness band like the Garmin Vivosmart 3 (which I also have and love).
customer_reviews.author: Sandan KenpoTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for Nana!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Nana's 67th birthday. She's not very good with technology so I was a bit hesitant but she kept saying she wanted one (she walks a lot and exercises a lot too). I figured it was worth a shot and if anything I would just return it. This fitbit was perfect for her. It fits her perfectly and once her and I figured out how to use it, she's now a pro at it. Super easy. Battery life is fantastic, and it is pretty accurate. Would totally recommend for young and old alike!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK.  Cheated out of refund money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep track my steps during the day. This function absolutely does not work. Sleep function is also useless. I don’t wear watches but this has one for those who do like them. The only feature that works is the heart rate monitor and if it wasn’t for this I’d sent it back. Oh.....and it buzzes for calls or texts if you like that idea. SECOND REVIEW Heart rate monitor is off also......I sent it back. PAID $142 for this and refund was $2! AMAZING RIPOFF BY THIS COMPANY! I WOULD RATHER HAVE IT BACK THAN TWO BUCKS.....THEY SHOULD HAVE JUST SAID NO REFUND. CUSTOMER SERVICE NON-EXISTANT. THEY DON’T RETURN EMAIL.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi Sheward

customer_reviews.title: Wear it in the correct position on the wrist. It makes a difference.
customer_reviews.text: Band was a bit uncomfortable but I got used to it after a couple weeks. Finally ordered a better band and it changed out easily. Snaps right on. Make sure u wear it above the wristbone. If it falls below the bone and touches your hand, the hr will skyrocket. Puts me in 105-115 range when I’m sitting still. Guess the blood flows much faster in the hands. Other than that, easy to use and i love it.
customer_reviews.author: stargazerlmd

customer_reviews.title: No Strava HR monitor integration or cycling
customer_reviews.text: Does not support cycling as an application and does not get recognized by Strava as a simple heart rate monitor due to Fitbit's closed data ecosystem. Very inaccurate compared to a scosche hr monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 6 months ago. Soon after purchase, charging has been a problem. After the first few times that the unit did not charge, I went out of my way to check the cable and verify the “clip” was correctly connected. Yet, a good quarter of the time, after a few hours, the unit will not take the charge (when it works it only takes about an hour). A week ago, one side of the wristband has simply fallen off. It no longer stays attached and I’ve purchased a replacement. Overall, for what it does, it is overpriced. I would not recommend the Fitbit Alta.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Broke after only 6 months. Band is poorly made. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: erica campbell

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Alta HR Sync Issues
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! Best to review Fitbit site for common issues, in particular - syncing. The device does not work with all phones. Except you don't easily know that fact until you purchase the device, and then can't sync. Fitbit's solution - get a new phone device. You also can't rely on their list of "non-compatible" phone devices, as others report it is out of date. Basically, I have now an expensive pedometer, as I can't track my data points beyond what is showing at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Reccomend
customer_reviews.text: After wearing this a couple of months I am ready to buy something else. You have to tap it multiple times to get the face to show the info. My band on comes apart multiple times a day. It is an easy fix but again annoying. I find it to be very uncomfortable to sleep with it on and therefore can’t get the sleep readings. Spend more get better!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit are Junk
customer_reviews.text: less than two months, the battery is completely dead. A charge only lasts a few hours. FitBit will only replace this with the same version. i get the same Alta HR and alas, within two months - the battery is not working again! So the options are to get another replacement? what a piece of junk. Ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley L. Stanhope

customer_reviews.title: I've just received it and started tracking my exercise. ...
customer_reviews.text: I've just received it and started tracking my exercise. It really motivates me to get up and move with the hourly silent vibration alarms to get up and start walking. There are many functions that I haven't started using yet but I will in time. I have 3 complaints... 1) I cannot read it outside while I'm walking no matter how much I try to shield it from the sun, 2) the Fitbit company seems to keep having trouble with their program to automatically sync it with the app on my phone and 3) even though I have followed every instruction to the letter, it is not communicating with my Weight Watcher app to send my exercise report.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Fitbit. This one lasted one day less that a year. My previous Fitbit Alta last just almost 2. I take care of things. In the last few years I have purchased these trackers for my family as gifts. They have also had trouble with them lasting. I am disappointed that this one did not last long. I do not plan to buy a new one every year or so. I am looking at other brands of fitness trackers.
customer_reviews.author: Boymom

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Sync with Android Pie
customer_reviews.text: The Alta HR seemed to work flawlessly with IOS but would NOT sync - even turning on, as a matter of fact - with Android Pie (hence the "neutral" 3-star rating). My numerous troubleshooting attempts (with Fitbit Customer Support, Fitbit Community, etc.) have not produced any results. The Fitbit Community site is flooded with similar frustration from Fitbit - Android phone owners. Fitbit apparently does not seem to care and/or has done anything at all to resolve this issue. If you own a non-IOS phone, do NOT buy Fitbit products!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: I've purchased a Charge HR, Charge 2, and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a Charge HR, Charge 2, and Alta HR in the last two years, for my girlfriend. There were tracking issues with both the Charge HR and Charge 2, but there are so many issues with the Alta HR that she refuses to wear it and went back to her Charge 2. I missed the 30 day Amazon return policy by 4 days. I then contacted Fitbit, as they have a 45 day satisfaction guarantee. It turns out that is only if you purchase the product from their site. I don't plan on purchasing another product from them.
customer_reviews.author: Talos

customer_reviews.title: Counts less than 70% of steps
customer_reviews.text: Would give no stars if I could. Tracks less than 70% of steps. Old Flex 2 Fitbit was accurate. This is junk. Trying new one but not optimistic. Online Fitbit Community - every comment in Alta HR is the same. Called Fitbit and tried everything suggested. After 45 min on phone, no change. Re-started, re-loaded - will try one more Alta but if that doesn’t work will go to different brand and give up on Fitbit. Wish they still made Flex 2 instead of this expensive piece of inaccurate junk.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: Two fit bits in a row non functioning. I bought this as a Christmas present. Had to have it sent back, ordered a new one. THAT one also did not work. Ask yourself the statistical average of 2 not working then ask yourself if you feel lucky. I bought this one because of all the “rave” reviews and look what it got me!!! Do yourself a favor and go buy one someone else has used and likes.
customer_reviews.author: Ronni M Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap wristband
customer_reviews.text: I have had this band for 10 months now. The plastic band is horrible. It falls apart almost every day. I have almost lost my band several,times. For a product that cost almost $100 I shouldn’t have to worry about it falling off my wrist because it comes apart with my activity. Also I really wanted a sleep tracker but this doesn’t work that well. It says I am asleep even when I have very sleepless nights. Just doesn’t seem accurate. Many times when I look at app it doesn’t register my activity and the. Hours later it will show up
customer_reviews.author: LYNNE

customer_reviews.title: After purchasing 3 Fitbit products, I quit.
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit products have been a disappointment, I have experience with 3 products over the last 3 years. 1) Got Fitbit Alta once, it broke in six months, straps were lose. 2) Got Fitbit charge, the straps are fine, but the battery lost all retention in about 3 months. Now the clock jumps around because the battery dies randomly and my data is lost. It’s unreliable. 3) Got one for my mom (this was while Charge worked fine, otherwise I wouldn't make this mistake) and the straps broke despite minimal use. Never buying anything from this company. Cheap quality products. I should’ve invested in Apple Watch, now I regret it. Save your money please. There are better products out there.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Does not meet expectations.
customer_reviews.text: The heart rate monitor works less than 50% of the time and when it is reading a heart rate, it is incorrect. I tried adjusting the tightness and position, as well as trying different bands. The screen is supposed to turn on when you turn the watch towards your body. This rarely worked. I ended up tapping excessively to get the screen to turn on. As a size small, it is actually quite big on my wrist. It sticks out far on each side, despite trying different bands. In order to charge, I had to connect/disconnect/reconnect numerous times for the watch to recognize the charger. The pros: the distance walked/ran seemed fairly accurate.
customer_reviews.author: lovesamazon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep count of the steps correctly!
customer_reviews.text: Steps do not track correctly! Upon awakening & already had 461 calories burned? I should be fit as a fiddle if just getting out of bed burns that many calories! These companies overthink themselves right out of a product! The first “band” Fitbit I gt stated the time & my steps. Simple!! Good to go! Worked like a charm until the company out-timed the product to make you buy a new one. Greed takes over again! On the search for a simple step counter.....,..period!
customer_reviews.author: CMMacy

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 6 months before it DIED!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 6 months but then died. After spending $150 you would think that it would last longer then just 6 months. I always took care of it, never in any water. I ordered a new one as I do like the Alta HR. Hopefully this one last longer than 6 months. UPDATE: The replacement only lasted 7.5 months when the HR function failed. Showed my heart rate being 250 BPM while sleeping and then would drop to 20 BPM when I was awake. This also messed up the sleep data. Basically it is nothing more than a basic watch now. Not worth it. This is the last Fitbit I will ever buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Beware !!  Does not pair with Samsung S10
customer_reviews.text: I really do get tired of fitness trackers that REQUIRE pairing with a phone. Can not set time, count steps, ... anything until paired. If you want to download massive fitness data, then pair it with a smart device HOWEVER, if just want a fitness tracker that has a touch screen that will recall data and display on the device avoid this. And then I find out after several hours of work and after a call to the service center, that this device will not pair with a Samsung S10. My 2011 car pairs with my Samsung S10. I'll bet I have a dial up modem that will pair with my S10, but not this Fitbit. Very,Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: vistosobill

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 1 year, then died a few months outside of warranty
customer_reviews.text: My wife really enjoyed the FitBit Alta HR when it worked. It was great at keeping track of steps and sleep cycles. With the HR sensor it was really cool being able to see the detailed sleep cycles and heartrate usage. HOWEVER: The unit itself stopped holding a charge 3 months after the 1 year warranty expired. Talking with FitBit support, they said they would not fix it and only offered a small discount on a new one. I'd expect to get at least 2 years of use out of a device like this, and for it to last just barely 1 is unacceptable. I won't be purchasing anything by FitBit again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. I've had it over a month and it does not work as it should. I've done everything the instructions tell me to do, but it doesn't work as promised. I have to tap the face several times to see the time and when I wear it to bed, it says that I haven't slept all night. Will probably end up selling it at a yard sale or giving it to charity. Would NOT recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia L. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: terrible customer service service.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working and connecting after less then 8 months of use. Customer service response was to offer a 25% discount on a new Fitbit. What a terrible shoddy piece of crap. Didn’t even last a year. Would seriously stay away from these people. Customer service just gives you the brush off. I mean seriously the response to just offer a 25% discount on a new Fitbit when the last o e didn’t last 8 months!?
customer_reviews.author: Deborah a windsor

customer_reviews.title: Product bug with calorie/active min counter
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time. I bought this in August 2018 and by December the active minutes and calories functionality had stopped working. Customer service can’t help because it’s a product bug their engineering team is trying to fix (they won’t share any other details or timeline). They also wouldn’t send me a replacement. I’ll be switching to the Apple Watch unfortunately. I had enjoyed FitBit until now but I can’t just “make it work” while they figure out a solution to their problems (what CS told me to do). What a shame
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Solid data, user-ability not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Overall the product does its job well. One persistent nuisance you may have heard on the street: turning the wrist or tapping to activate the display oddly is not consistent. You find yourself flicking your wrist back and forth, angrily tapping the screen while your coworkers whisper among each other "Is he doing ok? Is everything alright at home? Are we close enough as friends to ask?" Which is not why I purchased this watch. Stylish, yes. The overall inexpensive replacement bands mean you get to match with your rugged I-workout-with-dark-brooding-clothing or your I-wear-plaid-to-breweries evening ensemble with ease. But the tapping? Not fun.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, but not for treadmillers
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this! Helping me achieve my weight loss goals! I love the reminder to get walking each hour! Battery seems decently long enough, I just charge when I shower cause it’s not waterproof. Pretty sure it sometimes counts arm only movement as steps, so not 100% accurate there, but good enough to give me motivating a good idea of where I’m at. Also the exercise tracking function does not work well for treadmill exercise, as it uses gps on the phone instead of steps for distance and speed. Still, super happy and purchasing other bands to switch it up!
customer_reviews.author: KayJ

customer_reviews.title: Once battery was dead nothing I tried would recharge it.
customer_reviews.text: Received Alta HR in Feb 2019 and worked well until now (Aug 2109). The battery charge ran down to probably zero. I tried to charge it using original charger. Left it on for hours and no charge showed. Cleaned the contracts and lined up the charger - nothing. Tried the suggested reset many times with no results. Also tried different wall chargers and reset the position of the charger several times. Even ordered another charger from Amazon with same results. Very frustrating to have a device that worked well and now useless.. Any ideas??
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a Gift for GF & now I almost want one myself.
customer_reviews.text: So my gf is into health and fitness... Not in that annoying way thankfully. She does like to be generally aware of what's going on with her body, and this thing is perfect for that. tracks heart rate, sleep, an estimate of your spent calories and your activity trends. It's comfortable enough to sleep with, and i know this because she's picky with sleeping, its fun because she gets excited when she meets her goals so i guess it adds a fun dynamic to her active life. It's great, battery life is long and its comfortable & Stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Jared R. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Like some other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Like some other reviews, I really wanted to like this product. I reviewed all of the help online for issues relating to inaccurate heart rate and steps and activity -therefore wrong calories burned. I tried using the Alta HR for over a week and in the process moved the wrist band to various locations to see if the accuracy would be improved but to no avail. I was willing overlook the lack of water resistance but I can't overlook the basic ineffectiveness of this device. (oh, and it REALLY is virtually unusable outdoors... humph
customer_reviews.author: MikeS_Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Rubber wristbands break after 8 monts
customer_reviews.text: The product works fine but the rubber wristbands break after about 8 months - so after 16 months my warranty is out and the 2nd side of the wrist band broke and I have no recourse except to put more money into a watch that will probably break again in 8 months. Go buy a good watch for $130 - the fitbit is a silly gadget that is not well made.Update - Amazon replaced this first one that had 2 bands go bad in a year - now this one also had the band break. Seriously people - why spend money on this model? It's over $100 for a fitbit for less than 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bookman

customer_reviews.title: The tracking is good. I like it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this fitbit for just over 1 month now. The tracking is good. I like it. The problem is that the face is badly scratched up. I work a desk job. I don't wear it when doing house work or gardening. I don't go to the gym. I walk, use it to track sleep patterns and my heart rate. I called Fitbit to get some information on warranty. Scratches and cracks are not covered. So this is now $150 toy for my 2 year old grandson. Poor quality. I will never purchase another Fitbit ever. Very disappointed. I gave it 2 stars because it works really well for what I need. But I can't see it through the scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love, love love my new Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: Love, love love my new Fitbit. Had a charge2 and it was so big and bulky. Still wish that they would create a stylish piece of jewelry to accompany it, but for what you need it for. This is the best women's fitness bracelet I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Team Hola

customer_reviews.title: Perfect everyday use!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn my Fitbit everyday since I've bought it. I absolutely love it! There are alot of days that I forget I'm even wearing it. My charge lasts for a week, I haven't had any problems of it not counting my steps when pushing my daughter in her stroller, and I love that it tracks my sleep too! My only complaint is the band gets dirty from wear and I haven't found a solution to clean it. It's like its stained, so its lost its bright coral color. But, replacement bands are super cheap and super easy to swap out and now I have 3 new colors added to my collection!
customer_reviews.author: ShortStackNicky

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This Fitbit is relatively accurate and the app is easy to use. The main reason I gave it two stars is that it only lasted a year. The screen completely stopped working yesterday, almost exactly one year from when I got it. I had another Alta before this one that lasted two years, which wasn’t great, but I was okay with the forced biannual obsolescence. I am not okay with buying a new Fitbit every year. Might give them another chance, but I’m definitely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kailey

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love IT!
customer_reviews.text: I'm old and new to the exercise crew. I wanted to monitor my sleep pattern, count steps, analyze my food habits, and make sure I got in 250 minutes of exercise a week. Done. Holds a charge for 3 days, so far. It's not the new toy on the block but it works fabulously for me and is everything I needed. It's easy to read and is comfortable. I purchased a rose gold mesh band to interchange when dressing up. It matches my medic alert bracelet and will patina just right.
customer_reviews.author: Donise

customer_reviews.title: Will not receive phone (Android) notifications
customer_reviews.text: This would never receive phone notifications (calendar, text, phone call). Tried setting it up with two different Android phones. Samsung S7 and Samsung J3. Worked with Fitbit support for over an hour and we were never able to get it to work. I have two other Garmin devices that would work fine with notifications against these same phones ( Fenix 3 and Vivoactive 3 music ). Unfortunately it would never work with the Fitbit. Support was great they even sent me a new device to try, that failed as well. Not sure what the problem is. I'm very familiar with technology (15 years as a software developer)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Francis

customer_reviews.title: Died after 16 months
customer_reviews.text: I liked this a lot and wore it constantly, but it died after 16 months. I can't decide whether to buy another, since that doesn't seem like enough use for the cost. Sleep tracking and silent alarm are great features and I like knowing how I did in my workouts. So that's good stuff. Even with the turn-on feature disabled it glows kind of brightly at night against my wrist which isn't good for sleep. I often had trouble syncing it, which might be because I wasn't using the latest app updates. It's a little bulky. Mixed bag.
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with my Alta. I did not need all the features offered on more expensive models. I can still see time, steps, get text notifications, heart rate, calories and more. I also like that you can get a clock face that shows the date. Some other models didn't offer this feature. It is not over powering on my arm and is very comfortable. I like the sleek look. There are a lot of fashion bands for this. I did change the band and love it. It looks more like a really cool bracelet than a fitness band. I am completely satisfied that I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: MSdawg

customer_reviews.title: This was my 3rd and likely Last Fitbit; I liked my Charge HRs better. Not impressed with this model.
customer_reviews.text: This will be my last Fitbit...I previously had 2 Charge HRs that I literally wore out and they were worth every dollar; both lasted years. But, the Alta HR is not as comfortable (so have never worn it to bed for sleep data), my friends/family no longer use theirs so I miss the competition/accountability, I find the app less user friendly, and it is more of a pain to make it show the time--it usually takes me multiple attempts so less functional as a watch.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: SProblem with Syncing
customer_reviews.text: I really like the FitBit Alta HR. However, I would have liked to know before I bought it that it would not sync with my OnePlus 5T!!! Any day or any time of day I want to see the breakdown, I have to go to Play Store and uninstall then install again, enter the password etc. then I can see the results of my accomplishments or non-accomplishments. It is very, very frustrating and since my phone is a nice one, it's too expensive to buy another one just so I can sync my Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fitbit. It is working well, however this is a replacement to the first Fitbit that I purchased in November- it only lasted until last week (6 months) before it died after acting buggy for 1 day. Not sure if it was a bad batch, or something I did. Maybe I cleaned/wiped it with a cloth too much as I would often find a buildup on the back, probably from being a woman who wears lotions and perfumes. My boyfriend has had his Fitbit for almost 2 years without an issue, so I am giving the product another try!
customer_reviews.author: Erin M. Long

customer_reviews.title: Gives me a rash
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Occasionally buggy but nothing too difficult to resolve. The problem is that after a year and a half of wearing it, it gave me a rash on my wrist. I broke out in an itchy, scaly, red rash right where the charging element makes contact with my skin. I took the Fitbit off for a month, the rash healed up and went away. Put it back on, washed/sanitized the Fitbit every day but the rash was back in a week. I like the way it functions but I can't wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Device, Ads Ruin It
customer_reviews.text: It is a great little device, especially for keeping track of sleep. However, I find companies who sell expensive items and then subject you to CONSTANT ADVERTISING on their app really lame! If I download a free app I expect to be annoyed by adds, but when I buy not so cheap piece of hardware and that REQUIRES an app, I assume the company won't constantly annoy me and try to get me to buy a subscription to their "Premium" service. By the way, nearly all reviews online say the "Premium" service is more annoying than useful, so that makes the advertising even more obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: Zoriah R Miller

customer_reviews.title: Short life before the flu
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this for a year and a half now. I was hoping the watch wouldnt give me any issies until at least the three year mark. Every time my silent alarm goes off, the watch turns off. I have to reset it to get it to work agin . And ive tried resetting it multiple times aftereards, and it's still not working. Ive unpaired and paired it, and deleted and redid the alarm for a different time. Otherwise it's great. But im highly disappointed with the short life span.
customer_reviews.author: Diana H.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work great. It sometimes can't be seen to sync on my PC. Google searches all talk about rebooting the Alta HR which for me doesn't work. To get it to be recognized when it won't sync I have to go into Bluetooth settings on the PC and make it forget the device and then re-pair the device with the PC, I can also reboot the PC and it will then be recognized. My husband's Surge has the exact same issue with her PC. Fitbit has some work to do on their Bluetooth implementation!
customer_reviews.author: Wilkes W

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but cheaply made novelty item
customer_reviews.text: I love this gadget. Till recently, I thought the only negative was that it doesnt track steps or effort when I push my Moms wheelchair. (I worked around that by wearing it on my leg, held in place by a sock.) But it stopped working after 14 months and Fitbit said 'too bad, so sad, warranty is one year'. So while I still like the gadget, I now see it as an expensive novelty item. I did buy a second one before I knew about Fitbit's stance. When this one dies, I'll get a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rintac

customer_reviews.title: Completely Satisfied with Fitbit Alta HR
customer_reviews.text: Really nice software. You can go outside for a walk and then download the data when you are home. It does it automatically. Graphs of heart rate and steps versus hours are really nice. Heart rate agrees with two other devices that I use. Steps seems accurate enough but I have studied it. Sleep data is good and it seems correct. I sent four other moniters back, including one that strap to my chest. All had complicated software and graphical displays were not helpful to me, when I could get them. Fitbit is expensive but it is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my wife for mother’s day last year. Last week she noticed the display looked funny. Today it’s dead and won’t turn on. We think it’s water damage. It was never submerged in water, but I know she’s splashed it with water several times. So despite the claims of being water proof...NOT EVEN CLOSE. Find a cheaper, better fitness tracker elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: S.Brymer

customer_reviews.title: Great Motivator
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can set hourly, daily, and weekly goals through the app. Nothing is more satisfying than when you hit your goal and the fireworks appear on the watch screen. I enjoy the motivation every hour at the 50 minute mark when fitbit encourages you to take steps to meet your hourly goal. It's shocking how many hours I don't walk at all. It's all part of having a desk job I guess. I would recommend that you get a replacement band that is more comfortable and easier to clean than the rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget the dongle if computer doesn't have Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: I took a star off because to sync to a desktop computer running Windows 7, you need a fitbit compatible usb dongle. You would think they would include one in the box but it doesn't and isn't mentioned in the description of the product that I could see. I purchased one of these ] I gave this fitbit to someone as a gift and now they have to wait a couple more days before they can sync to their computer. I was able to sync to a phone and a tablet and the features I'm still getting used to but it seems like a nice device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it. I asked her if she can tell if she is wearing it. She said she can but it doesn’t bother her at all. She likes the color too. My wife is pregnant and it is really nice to be able to monitor her sleep and heart rate. She hasn’t been getting enough sleep. And when she naps, it turns out that she only falls asleep sometimes. I have an Apple Watch, but what I really need is something like this where it monitors my sleep and doesn’t need to be charged everyday. I’m gonna buy one for myself today
customer_reviews.author: saics

customer_reviews.title: ... fit bit charge because everyone said it was far superior to the alta
customer_reviews.text: About a year ago I purchased a fit bit charge because everyone said it was far superior to the alta. However, I could never get over how bulky it is (I’m a woman). There are some trade offs for the Alta (not quite as easy to read, for some reason I don’t always see my messages and this was never a problem with thit charge). Overall, I much prefer the Alta to the Charge. As a side note, I think the black band is the way to go. If it wasn’t so expensive I think the gunmetal is most classy. I had the teal band for h charge and it looked cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: This is a piece of junk.  Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Suddenly this piece of junk quit keeping track of my sleep. I usually go to bed around 9 or 9:30 and am asleep pretty soon thereafter. This piece of junk reports that I go to sleep at 11:00 or later every night. Called product support one time, couldn't understand half of what the person on the phone was saying, he got an attitude with me. Now I can't even return this junk because the "return window has closed" Pure junk
customer_reviews.author: Scatter

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to lose it
customer_reviews.text: I loved my FitBit Alta HR. I thought it worked fine, so why one star? Because this is the second one I've purchased that just fell off my arm... this one after only 5 month's use. It loosens where it connects to the face. Since I didn't notice it was gone, I never found it, and I never will because that was on vacation in China. And what does the company offer me, 25% off a new one. No thanks. I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: JC Jazze

customer_reviews.title: Get woke
customer_reviews.text: Like literally. I love the alarm feature. And can I say that NAMASTE fitbit you are so consciousness raising. OOOOOH THAT'S how much I'm sleeping / how I'm sleeping (when I'm dreaming!) / how hard I'm working out / my resting heartrate when that person I hate comes by (spike!) / how much more sedentary I am midweek / when my boyfriend pees at night / everything. I was a stranger to myself before. I am usually more of a qualitative non-tech kind of girl but that means I had that much more to learn! This has made me #woke
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Defective Battery Issue - Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. This device will last a year at best. The battery will not withhold charge and when you contact support they will only offer you a discount to purchase a new device when its the defective battery causing the issue. Great device, but too much to pay for something that lasts a year at best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’ll help you cheat on your step count!
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and buy the product protection. If your experience is like mine you’ll need it. The actual tracking of your steps is WAY off. This Fitbit tracks anytime I raise my arm, pet the dog, pet the cat and logs it all as steps. This started about three weeks ago. Such a disappointment since this sucker wasn’t cheap. I’ve tried wearing the Fitbit tighter and loser than the normal and still receive the same results.
customer_reviews.author: SevansTop Contributor: Pets

product_meta.title: Fitbit Alta HR
product_meta.description:
Keep track of your heartbeat, daily steps and more with this versatile Fitbit Alta HR fitness wristband. This sophisticated fitness tracker sits on your wrist, where it reminds you to stay active and automatically logs your workout routine via SmartTrack technology. Connect this large black Fitbit Alta HR fitness wristband to your smart device to monitor your daily habits.

Features:
All day activity tracking with continuous heart rate
Track calorie burn, heart rate, gauge workout intensity and get a picture of your overall health without an uncomfortable chest strap.

Sleep tracking with sleep stages
Automatically tracks how long you sleep, shows your time spent in light, deep and REM sleep, and has a silent alarm to help you wake more peacefully.

Clear, bright OLED tap display
Gives you instant access to stats, the time and smartphone notifications.

Auto exercise recognition
SmartTrack technology automatically detects and logs workouts to the Fitbit dashboard, so you get credit without ever pushing a button.

Smartphone notifications
Keeps you connected with call, text and calendar notifications on display, so you never miss the messages that matter.

Reminders to move
Tracker sends you friendly reminders to move that encourage you to stay active and help you fit more movement into your day.

Adjustable strap
Fits comfortably on most wrists from 6.7" to 8.1" in circumference.

Syncs to select Apple, Android and Windows devices
Such as iPhone, iPad, iPod touch and cell phones and tablets with Windows Phone or Android for simple wireless communication.

Monitor your goals and interact with friends
You can set goals, track your progress, connect with friends and share your milestones, get personalized fitness coaching and more with special Fitbit app.
